snippet: Drought and the pumping of water have depleted the delta smelt and the delicate ecosystem they inhabit, prompting limits on the amount of water sent to farmers and cities.
abstract: Delta smelt population in Northern California, where tiny rare fish inhabits state's biggest river delta, has been decimated by drought and pumping of water to areas as far south as Los Angeles; as California faces a likely fourth year of drought, smelt is potent symbol in national debate over balancing needs of endangered species with those of state's residents, farmers and businesses for adequate water supplies.
lead_paragraph: Drought and the pumping of water have depleted the delta smelt and the delicate ecosystem they inhabit, prompting limits on the amount of water sent to farmers and cities.

headline.main: Threatened Smelt Touches Off Battles in California’s Endless Water Wars
headline.print_headline: Threatened Smelt Touches Off Battles in California’s Endless Water Wars
